data: BMT AMB Severe Sepsis Initial Management
All patients with fever of unknown origin should immediately start the BMT AMB Febrile Neutropenia Initial Management PowerPlan.
All orders should be implemented within one hour of patient arrival
Record blood pressure and heart rate q30min for 1 hour then provider to reassess
Record blood pressure, heart rate and respiratory rate q30min for 1 hour then provider to reassess
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
NOtify provieder if lactate is 4 mmol/L opr greater and/or systolic blodd pressure less than 90 mmHg following completion of bolus fluids
Move patient to bed and maintain patient in semi-recumbant position
500 mL, IV, q15min, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, q30min, order duration: 2 doses or times, administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag
Consider hydrocortisone for septic shock when hypotension responds poorly to adequate fluid resuscitation nad if patient was on prolonged steroids within the last 3 months
50 mg, IV, q6h interval, drug form: inj
500 mg, IV, q6h interval, drug form: inj
Venous Blood, STAT, Collection: T;N, once
Venous Blood, Timed, q2h interval for 3 doses or times
Consider consultation to Critcal Care Outreach Team (CCOT)
Routine, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Requires constant monitoring/observation
